newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's Smart, NTT form joint venture firm.
newsitem.headline: Manila's Smart, NTT form joint venture firm.

text.p: Philippine cellular phone company Smart Communications Inc said on Tuesday it and affiliate Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp (NTT) are setting up a joint venture firm to provide multi-media services in the country.
In a statement, Smart said the application to form Smart NTT Multimedia Inc, the joint venture firm, has been submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

"The convergence of computers, entertainment and telecommunications is reshaping all these industries and creating a growing demand for multimedia services," said Smart president Orlando Vea in the statement.
The company said the joint venture will be able to introduce NTT's broadband services to the Philippine market.
Initial investment in the venture may reach about 250 million pesos, the company said.
Smart is a joint venture of Metro Pacific Corp, its parent First Pacific Co Ltd and NTT.
